channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Great Leaders Share 3 Rare Behaviors. Most Bosses Skip All of Them
item.description: They’re not complicated, but they’re uncommon—and they instantly raise trust and performance on any team.

item.title: Not Even Nvidia Can Fight the Fed
item.description: The tech rally proved short-lived as jobs data dashed hopes for a rate cut in December.

item.title: How to transform burnout to breakthrough
item.description: The modern workplace runs on a dangerous myth: that constant motion equals maximum productivity . We’ve built entire corporate cultures around this fa...

item.title: Google is spending $40 billion to build 3 new data centers in Texas
item.description: Google has 44 data centers in operation or in development around the world, but as demand for AI and the need for compute capacity grows, the company ...

item.title: ‘Don’t sell just because there’s a bubble,’ says Ray Dalio, but be prepared for low returns over be next 10 years
item.description: "I think the picture is pretty clear in that we are in that territory of a bubble, but we don't have the pricking of the bubble yet," Dalio said.

item.title: Skims founding partner Emma Grede schedules an ‘AI day’ once every six weeks to future-proof her career: ‘It’s like do or die’
item.description: Upskilling in AI is unavoidable as workers look to ‘future-proof our organizations and ourselves,’ Grede added.

item.title: USA Rare Earth CEO describes ‘Manhattan Project’ to wean U.S. from dependence on China
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Sam Altman’s eye-scanning orb startup says employees should only care about work—for the good of humanity—otherwise ‘you should just not be here’
item.description: “We work weekends, we're always on call, and we push as hard as our circumstances allow us to,” Tools for Humanity CEO Alex Blania said in a January s...

item.title: Digital Driver’s License? Apple and Illinois Get It. Your Business Should Too
item.description: Business owners should expect Apple’s New Digital ID technology to spread nationwide and expand to provide additional functionality.

item.title: Starbucks’ CEO Is Making a Very Big Mistake—and It’s Destroying What Made the Company Great
item.description: Starbucks CEO Brian Niccol wants to return the world’s biggest coffeehouse to its roots, but his plan is doing the opposite.

item.title: Steve Jobs Said This is the Best Reason to Start Your Own Business
item.description: To Jobs, the only way to become ‘three dimensional’ is to completely own the process, and the results.

item.title: The IPO market is being re-globalized as Asia’s markets embrace dual listings and corporate governance reform
item.description: Asian companies are increasingly exploring the possibility of listing in non-U.S. markets.

item.title: This paint-like coating lets buildings collect water from the air
item.description: With little more than a coat of paint, buildings could soon make the air around them cooler and harvest gallons of water directly from the atmosphere....

item.title: We’ve taught AI to sound human, but we all need to remind ourselves to be better ones
item.description: AI has made us faster and more productive at work. It drafts our emails, summarizes our meetings, and even reminds us to take breaks. But here’s the p...
